intro: Demidofia nodosa, commonly known as the nodding demidofia, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its unique feature is the nodding appearance of its inflorescence, which resembles a cluster of tiny umbels. The species is of interest to botanists due to its morphological traits and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
